{"step_by_step_thinking": "Mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) are indeed multipotent stromal cells that can differentiate into a variety of cell types, including osteoblasts (bone cells), chondrocytes (cartilage cells), myocytes (muscle cells) and adipocytes (fat cells which give rise to marrow adipose tissue). Therefore, they are considered multipotent.", "answer_choice": "A"}
